page.title: 08Orchid Business, Passfield.
page.content: This flourishing business was started 14 years ago and is run personally by the owner with 1 regular assistant and 2 to 3 casual helpers when required. The orchids are propagated and grown on the premises.The peak flowering season is early January to late May;during this period the flowers,in specialised packing,are distributed to wholesale outlets mainly florists and large hotels in London and are also retailed both by post and direct. Near Easter the orchid houses have been open to delight visitors and to aid the Red Cross.The tall spikes of Cymbidium orchids rise 4 feet from beds of wood bark,peat,vermiculite and fertiliser, with up to 25 blooms on a spike.The subtle shades of colour,pink green, white, yellow, terra-cotta and lovely browns tempt anyone to send an orchid 'direct'.
